intro: Ceropegia rara, commonly known as the rare African starfish, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces unique, star-shaped blooms that are typically pale yellow or greenish-white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is a sought-after plant among collectors and botanists.
